alert.note: Alert for Humphreys (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 7:01PM CST until February 28 at 10:48AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River Near Hurricane Mills affecting Humphreys County. For the Duck River...including Hurricane Mills...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Duck River Near Hurricane Mills. * WHEN...From this evening to late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Portions of Tumbling Creek Road east of Highway 13 are flooded to a depth of 2 feet and may be impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 20.7 feet and rising. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 PM CST Wednesday was 20.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.0 feet Saturday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.9 feet on 12/11/1951. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 100 PM CST.
